intro: Asperula platygona, commonly known as the broad-leaved asperula, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant features oval, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces fragrant, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in early spring.
